newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee jumps at end in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee jumps at end in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee jumped 0.10 to 41.20 to the dollar in kerb market at Saturday's close after the IMF weclomed an economic reform package announced by the government on Friday, dealers said.
"The IMF's support to the government's package has strengthened the rupee as people now expect a sharp rise in the stock market now," dealer Owais Kalia said.

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates ended down at 3.0 percent from Friday's close at 3.20 percent. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
